ranked_diseases.explanation: ALPS presents with autoimmune cytopenias including hemolytic anemia, and can have gastrointestinal manifestations including chronic diarrhea. Age of onset is typically in early childhood.
Similar to Type IA ALPS with autoimmune hemolytic anemia and potential GI involvement, but with different genetic basis.
IPEX syndrome classically presents with chronic diarrhea/enteropathy and autoimmune manifestations including hemolytic anemia in male patients during infancy/early childhood.
CVID can present with autoimmune cytopenias including hemolytic anemia and chronic diarrhea due to infections or inflammatory bowel disease-like symptoms.
Primary autoimmune enteropathy causes chronic diarrhea and can be associated with other autoimmune manifestations including hemolytic anemia.
Very early onset IBD can present with chronic diarrhea and extraintestinal manifestations including autoimmune hemolytic anemia.
Pediatric SLE can present with autoimmune hemolytic anemia and gastrointestinal involvement including chronic diarrhea, though other features are usually present.
